meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by three measurements or dimensions.
meanings.sent1: The trimetric drawing showed the object from three different angles.
meanings.sent2: The architect used a trimetric scale to accurately represent the building's dimensions.
meanings.sent3: The trimetric view of the room made it look like a tiny dollhouse.
meanings.sent4: Her trimetric analysis of the problem revealed new insights.
meanings.sent5: The trimetric map helped us navigate the complex terrain with ease.

meanings.definition: Having three beats to a measure.
meanings.sent1: The trimetric rhythm of the music made it easy to dance to.
meanings.sent2: The song had a catchy trimetric pattern that stuck in my head.
meanings.sent3: The trimetric beat of the drum echoed through the room.
meanings.sent4: Her trimetric clapping added a unique flair to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The trimetric melody flowed smoothly, captivating the audience.

meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful trimetric of the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The trimetric displayed the building's design in great detail.
meanings.sent3: The trimetric of the sculpture made it seem almost lifelike.
meanings.sent4: The trimetric model helped visualize the final construction project.
meanings.sent5: The trimetric illustration added depth to the textbook's diagrams.
